shortdesc.ph: Publishes the local stream to a specified CDN live streaming URL.

p.codeblock: public abstract int addPublishStreamUrl(String url, boolean transcodingEnabled);
virtual int addPublishStreamUrl(const char* url, bool transcodingEnabled) = 0;
abstract addPublishStreamUrl(url: string, transcodingEnabled: boolean): number;
public abstract int AddPublishStreamUrl(string url, bool transcodingEnabled);
Future<void> addPublishStreamUrl( {required String url, required bool transcodingEnabled});

dlentry.dd: This method is deprecated. Use or instead according to your needs.

section.p: After calling this method, you can push media streams in RTMP or RTMPS protocol to the CDN. The SDK triggers the callback on the local client to report the state of adding a local stream to the CDN.

ul.li: Call this method after joining a channel.
Ensure that the Media Push function is enabled. For details, see the prerequisites in Media Push.
This method takes effect only when you are a host in live interactive streaming.
This method adds only one streaming URL to the CDN each time it is called. To push multiple URLs, call this method multiple times.

plentry.pd: The Media Push URL in the RTMP or RTMPS format. The maximum length of this parameter is 1024 bytes. The URL address must not contain special characters, such as Chinese language characters.

pd.p:
Whether to enable transcoding. Transcoding in a CDN live streaming converts the audio and video streams before pushing them to the CDN server. It applies to scenarios where a channel has multiple broadcasters and composite layout is needed.
: Enable transcoding.
: Disable transcoding.
pd.note: If you set this parameter as , ensurethat you call the method before calling this method.

ul.li:
< 0: Failure.
-2: Invalid parameter, usually an empty URL or a string with a length of 0.
-7: The engine is not initialized when streaming.
